meanings.definition: to change (food) into a form that can be used by the body
meanings.sent1: After eating, the body metabolized the nutrients from the food.
meanings.sent2: The digestive system metabolized the proteins into energy.
meanings.sent3: The stomach growled, eager to metabolize the delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: Her smile metabolized his worries, turning them into joy.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays metabolized the frost, warming the earth.

meanings.sent1: During exercise, the muscles metabolized to provide energy.
meanings.sent2: The medication metabolized quickly in his system.
meanings.sent3: The car seemed to metabolize fuel faster on the highway.
meanings.sent4: Time metabolized his anger, leaving only forgiveness.
meanings.sent5: The plant metabolized sunlight, growing taller each day.

meanings.definition: to break down (substances) in the body into simpler compounds
meanings.sent1: Enzymes help metabolize food into nutrients for the body.
meanings.sent2: The liver metabolizes toxins to keep the body healthy.
meanings.sent3: The blender seemed to metabolize the fruits into a delicious smoothie.
meanings.sent4: His words metabolized her confidence, breaking it down into self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The fire metabolized the wood, turning it into ashes.
